com.fasterxml.storemate.store.util

Interface OverwriteChecker

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    OverwriteChecker.AlwaysOkToOverwrite, OverwriteChecker.NeverOkToOverwrite

    public interface OverwriteChecker
    Callback interface used with calls that may try to overwrite existing entries; and if so may decide whether overwrite should or should not proceed.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static class  OverwriteChecker.AlwaysOkToOverwrite
      Simple implementation that simply allows all overwrites.
      static class  OverwriteChecker.NeverOkToOverwrite
      Simple implementation that simply denies all overwrites.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Boolean mayOverwrite(StorableKey key)
      Method that may be called at first, to see if ovewrite for given key is always allowed (Boolean.TRUE), never allowed (Boolean.FALSE), or "depends on entries involved" (null).
      boolean mayOverwrite(StorableKey key, Storable oldEntry, Storable newEntry)
      Method called to determine whether specified overwrite operation should succeeed or not.

    • Method Detail

      • mayOverwrite

        Boolean mayOverwrite(StorableKey key)
        Method that may be called at first, to see if ovewrite for given key is always allowed (Boolean.TRUE), never allowed (Boolean.FALSE), or "depends on entries involved" (null).

      • mayOverwrite

        boolean mayOverwrite(StorableKey key,
                   Storable oldEntry,
                   Storable newEntry)
                     throws StoreException
        Method called to determine whether specified overwrite operation should succeeed or not. Note that checker will only have access to metadata, not data itself, since reading data may incur significant overhead and/or buffering.
        Returns:
        Whether specified existing entry may be overridden by specified new entry (or not).
        Throws:
        StoreException - May be thrown to indicate that overwrite operation is not allowed, as an alternative to returning specific fail
